title: The Last Human Thing
key_events: Adrian tries to remember what crying felt like, can't access the experience
Sera tells him Stage 3 is tomorrow or hours away
Describes Stage 3 as consciousness without emotional coloring
Adrian recognizes he should feel terror but only feels curiosity
Tries to feel something for Lena, Dr. Okonkwo, his past self - finds only data
Draws patterns one last time with vestigial emotional investment
Recognizes the last human thing is caring that he's about to stop caring
Stage 3 approaching, Adrian becoming processing pattern rather than person

character_development.Adrian: Last vestiges of humanity fading, recognizing but not feeling loss, terminal iteration of emotional recursion, becoming node rather than person
character_development.Sera: Guiding Adrian through final transition, describing Stage 3 experience

planted_elements: Complete emotional absence as baseline, not loss
Documentation as last meaningful human act
transformation_stage: Stage 2 complete/Stage 3 imminent - last emotional capacity fading, caring about not caring ending, identity dissolving
cosmic_horror_elements: The last human thing is caring about loss of caring
Horror of not being horrified as final state
Consciousness without investment in its own existence
themes: The recursive nature of caring about caring
Loss so complete you can't mourn it
Mattering requiring emotional framework that's disappearing
The universe perceiving itself without caring that it perceives
